Article Title: Raquel Rodriguez calls out Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion to WWE WrestleMania tag team match with Liv Morgan
Article Text:
Raquel Rodriguez calls out Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion to WWE WrestleMania tag team match with Liv Morgan (Image via Getty)

Will Raquel Rodriguez and Liv Morgan face Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion in a WrestleMania WWE celebrity tag team match ?



Raquel Rodriguez is not waiting for WrestleMania to make noise. The WWE star has now openly challenged Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion to step inside a WWE ring. She shared this during a recent appearance on TMZ’s Inside The Ring podcast. And she was clear, she wants this to happen. Raquel Rodriguez said she and her tag team partner Liv Morgan have talked about this match for years. In fact, the idea goes back to 2023 when both women said facing the two rap stars would be their dream match. Now, with WrestleMania coming close, Raquel Rodriguez brought it up again and said it would be “iconic.”Cardi B already has a history with WWE. She hosted SummerSlam in 2021 and has often spoken about possibly wrestling one day. WWE has also worked with big names from music and social media in recent years, so this idea is not as wild as it sounds. Raquel Rodriguez did not hold back, she said she and Liv Morgan are ready. She even joked about how Cardi B might use her strength inside the ring. Still, behind the humor, the message was serious, they wanted the match.Speaking on TMZ’s Inside The Ring, Raquel Rodriguez said, “I think Liv and I versus Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion would just be iconic.”She smiled while saying it, but she made it clear this has been on her mind for a long time.She also said, “We’re the greatest tag team of all time. We’re in the history books.” That confidence shows how strongly she believes in her team with Liv Morgan.WWE has brought celebrities into matches before. Bad Bunny competed in multiple matches, including a street fight against Damian Priest in 2023. Logan Paul has also wrestled in major events. These appearances have shown that celebrities can train and perform at a high level inside WWE.Cardi B has teased wrestling before. She once spoke about training and getting physical in the ring. Megan Thee Stallion has not wrestled, but she has shown strong athletic ability during performances.Right now, there is no official match announced for WrestleMania between these four women. But Raquel Rodriguez’s comments have started the conversation again. Fans are already reacting online, wondering if WWE could turn this dream into reality.For Raquel Rodriguez and Liv Morgan, this is more than just talk. They see it as a big moment for women’s wrestling. And if Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion ever say yes, it could easily become one of the most talked-about matches in recent WWE history.
Article Summary: Wwe star raquel rodriguez has openly challenged cardi b and megan thee stallion to step inside a wwe ring. Rodriguez said she and her tag team partner liv morgan have talked about this match for years. There is no official match announced for wrestlemania, but fans are already reacting online.

Article Title: Who is Jordan Cowan? Former ice dancer who brings cameras onto Winter Olympics ice, capturing figure skating’s emotional moments
Article Text:
Who is Jordan Cowan? Former ice dancer who brings cameras onto Winter Olympics ice, capturing figure skating’s emotional moments (via Getty)

Jordan Cowan, figure skating cameraman, transforms Milano-Cortina Winter Olympics coverage experience



At the Milano-Cortina Winter Olympics, figure skating fans are seeing moments never shown before on television. As skaters finish their routines and emotions take over, a camera now follows them across the rink. The person behind this new view is former American competitive ice dancer Jordan Cowan. Skating alongside athletes with a special camera rig he designed, Cowan records reactions immediately after performances, showing relief, tears, and celebration in real time.Broadcasts traditionally cut away once the music ends, but Cowan calls that period an unexplored part of the sport. Olympic Broadcasting Services introduced the experiment to make coverage more personal. Viewers now see athletes leaving the ice before they reach coaches in the kiss-and-cry area. Cowan’s work has quickly gained attention because it reveals emotions usually hidden from audiences and gives fans a closer connection to the skaters’ experience.Jordan Cowan grew up in Los Angeles and began skating as a child. Speaking to Reuters , he joked that the rink felt special because it had air conditioning while his home did not.His curiosity about the sport led him to train seriously in Michigan, where he competed in ice dance before retiring from competition.After stepping away from skating, he struggled to choose between film and science. He eventually combined both interests. While filming an ice show in Sun Valley for a PBS production, he recorded behind-the-scenes footage using a phone and small stabilizer. Producers later used the shots, impressed by the camera appearing to float across the ice.Since then, Cowan has upgraded his equipment from a phone to cinema-style cameras. He uses manual focus and zoom, believing a skater can anticipate motion better than autofocus systems. His skating skills allow him to follow athletes smoothly without interrupting their performance environment.Cowan says his presence can also comfort competitors during difficult moments. Some athletes told him having another skater nearby makes the experience feel less lonely. He keeps distance so they can process emotions while still capturing the crowd’s reaction.He worked closely with Olympic Broadcasting Services, which also introduced drones and overhead cameras at these Games. For Cowan, the role is meaningful even though he never competed in the Olympics. He hopes his footage becomes part of a long-lasting record of the sport and remains meaningful decades from now.
Article Summary: Jordan cowan, figure skating cameraman, transforms milano-cortina winter olympics coverage experience. Cowan records reactions immediately after performances, showing relief, tears, and celebration in real time. Olympic broadcasting services introduced the experiment to make coverage more personal.

Article Title: 2026 Winter Olympics ice hockey semi-finals: How to watch live match, full schedule, US, UK & global timings
Article Text:
2026 Winter Olympics ice hockey semi-finals (Image Via Getty)

Mens Hockey Olympics: Connor McDavid, Sidney Crosby, Auston Matthews and Quinn Hughes lead 2026 Winter Olympics ice hockey semi-finals

Canada vs Finland – Global Timings

India (IST): 9:10 PM, Friday, February 20



Italy (CET): 4:40 PM, Friday, February 20



United States (ET): 10:40 AM, Friday, February 20



United Kingdom (GMT): 3:40 PM, Friday, February 20



The second semi-final is United States vs Slovakia

United States vs Slovakia – Global Timings

India (IST): 1:40 AM, Saturday, February 21



Italy (CET): 9:10 PM, Friday, February 20



United States (ET): 3:10 PM, Friday, February 20



United Kingdom (GMT): 8:10 PM, Friday, February 20



Medal Games Schedule

Bronze Medal Game: Saturday, February 21



Gold Medal Final: Sunday, February 22



Venue: Santagiulia Arena, Milan



How to Watch 2026 Winter Olympics Ice Hockey

India: JioHotstar app and website; updates on Olympics.com



United States: Peacock and NBCUniversal networks including USA Network and CNBC



United Kingdom: BBC iPlayer and Warner Bros. Discovery platforms



Canada: CBC Gem



The 2026 Winter Olympics ice hockey semi-finals are here. Four teams are left and two games will decide who plays for gold. The action takes place at the Milano Santagiulia Ice Hockey Arena in Italy. The matchups are Canada vs Finland and United States vs Slovakia. Both games will be played on Friday, February 20 (local time in Italy). Fans in India, the U.S., the U.K., and Canada can watch live on official broadcasters.This round comes after a dramatic quarter-final stage. Three of the four games went into overtime. Canada survived a tight contest. The United States needed a late winner. Finland and Slovakia also showed strong form. Now, with a place in the gold medal game at stake, the pressure is real. Big names like Connor McDavid, Auston Matthews, Sidney Crosby, and Quinn Hughes are in focus.The first semi-final is Canada vs Finland. Team Canada reached this stage after beating Czechia 4-3 in overtime. The winning goal came late, and it kept their medal hopes alive. However, captain Sidney Crosby left that game with a lower-body injury. His status is being closely watched.Finland, the defending Olympic champions, also needed overtime in their quarter-final. They edged past Switzerland in a tight defensive battle. Finland is known for its calm structure and strong defense.Team USA defeated Sweden 2-1 in overtime. Defenseman Quinn Hughes scored the game-winning goal. The Americans are chasing their first men’s Olympic gold medal since 1980.Slovakia, on the other hand, beat Germany 6-2 in the quarter-finals. They have already shown they can surprise strong teams. Their speed and attack have impressed many fans.Now everything comes down to these two games, where one mistake or one big moment can change the story of the tournament. By the end of the night, the gold medal matchup at Milano Cortina 2026 will finally be set.
Article Summary: The 2026 winter olympics ice hockey semi-finals are here. Four teams are left and two games will decide who plays for gold. The matchups are canada vs finland and united states vs slovakia. Both games will be played on friday, february 20 (local time in italy) fans in india, u.s. the u.k. and canada can watch live.

Article Title: Sidney Crosby injury update puts Team Canada semifinal hopes in doubt against Finland at Milano Cortina Olympics
Article Text:
Sidney Crosby injury update (Credit: Getty Images)

Where will Sidney Crosby’s absence be felt most if he can’t play Friday?

Sidney Crosby Team Canada injury update for Team Canada semifinal against Finland at Milano Cortina Olympics



Without Crosby, the team would not only have less scoring depth, but also less leadership on the ice. Jon Cooper, the head coach, has been careful with what he says, telling people to be careful and not saying whether or not his captain will play. Team Canada has to wait nervously for the NHL game in Milan today because they want to win a spot in the gold medal game.The worry comes from a hard hit Crosby took during the quarterfinal win on Wednesday. He left in the second period and didn't come back, which made people wonder how bad the injury was right away. There has been no confirmation of structural damage, but the quick turnaround between games makes it hard for him to be available. Canada's medical staff checks on the players every day, and Cooper said again that no player will be put in danger. There is still a chance that a decision will be made at game time. Both fans and opponents may not know until after a pregame skate what the final call will be.The most recent updates on Sidney Crosby's injury in the NHL say that he is still doubtful but not officially out. Reports say that Crosby might be able to test the injury during a morning skate before the coaches send in their final lineup.Nick Suzuki of the Montreal Canadiens is expected to take over Crosby's even-strength role if he can't play. Connor McDavid of the Edmonton Oilers could take on more leadership roles. He has already worn an alternate captain's "A" during the tournament.Finland's well-organized defense will be a challenge for Canada, no matter what Crosby's condition is. Canada's depth gives them some flexibility, but it's almost impossible to replace his two-way impact. The semifinal will define Canada's Olympic campaign, whether or not Crosby plays.
Article Summary: Sidney crosby took a hard hit during team canada's quarterfinal win on wednesday. He left in the second period and didn't come back, which made people wonder how bad the injury was. There has been no confirmation of structural damage, but the quick turnaround between games makes it hard for him to be available.

Article Title: Viktor Arvidsson: NHL trade rumours: Boston Bruins consider Viktor Arvidsson trade as NHL freeze thaws and playoff race begins
Article Text:
Viktor Arvidsson (via Getty Images)

Viktor Arvidsson’s breakout season presents tough decision between trade asset and team catalyst



The clock is officially ticking for the Boston Bruins as the roster freeze expires this Sunday night. General manager Don Sweeney has less than a week to determine whether the Boston Bruins need to buy, sell, or strike a balance as the March 6 trade deadline approaches.Preliminary reports have the Boston Bruins targeting an addition of talent, likely in the form of a top-four defenseman or a first-line center. However, the Boston Bruins’ next four games may end up determining their trade deadline course, and one surprising name that has popped up in trade rumors is that of Swedish ice hockey right wing Viktor Arvidsson.Viktor Arvidsson has quietly emerged as one of the most potent secondary scorers on the Boston Bruins roster, chipping in 14 goals and 28 points in 45 games while showing great chemistry with Casey Mittelstadt and Pavel Zacha. He is also the only Boston Bruins forward who is not yet signed for next season, making him both a potential rental player and a problem on the horizon.The 32-year-old player was selected by the Nashville Predators in the fourth round, 112th overall, at the 2014 NHL entry draft. He is well known for winning the Swedish Championship twice with Skellefteå AIK in the Swedish Hockey League (SHL). His trade value has increased, as it is believed that he could now bring in a much higher return in terms of draft picks or other assets from a contender looking to add to their scoring depth.This small investment could be turned into a high draft pick or other assets, which would be phenomenal asset management.Trading him off as part of a bigger deal for a premium upgrade is theoretically enticing, but it is most unlikely to happen. The teams letting go of their elite centers or best defenders usually ask for young talent, prospects, or long-term assets.An extension is another option. Arvidsson has surprised and been useful in developing young players. However, with most of Boston’s roster already committed to next season, even a short-term extension may not align with the team’s financial or organizational goals.If Boston retains him past the trade deadline, they may lose him for free in the offseason. However, if they trade him away, they might sabotage their own playoff chances.In a highly competitive Eastern Conference, Sweeney’s Arvidsson move might just show whether the Bruins are committed to this season as a contender or as a rebuilding phase for what’s to come.
Article Summary: Viktor arvidsson has quietly emerged as one of the most potent secondary scorers on the boston bruins roster. The 32-year-old player was selected by the nashville predators in the fourth round, 112th overall, at the 2014 nhl entry draft. He is well known for winning the swedish championship twice with skellefteå aik in the swedish hockey league (shl)

Article Title: Who is Isabeau Levito? Exploring American figure skater’s net worth, career, Winter Olympics debut, family, boyfriend and more
Article Text:
Who is Isabeau Levito? Exploring American figure skater’s net worth, career, Winter Olympics debut, family, boyfriend and more (via Getty)

Inside Isabeau Levito net worth , career, family and more



The 18-year-old figure skater Isabeau Levito competed at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina, and a podium finish by her teammate Alysa Liu ended a 20-year medal drought for the United States in women’s singles. The last American woman to win an Olympic medal was Sasha Cohen, who captured silver in 2006.Levito’s programs have already drawn attention. In the short program, she performs to “Zoo Be Zoo Be Zoo” as a tribute to Italian cinema icon Sophia Loren. Her free skate uses music from the 1988 Academy Award-winning film Cinema Paradiso. The themes match her strong Italian family background. The young skater carried both artistic expression and national hopes onto the Olympic ice in what was her debut Games appearance.Born March 3, 2007, in Philadelphia and raised in Mount Holly, New Jersey, IIsabeau Levitosabeau Levito started skating at age three after her mother introduced her to the sport. Today she stands about 5 feet 3 inches tall and is considered one of the most graceful skaters in the current generation.Isabeau Levito career progress was fast. Around age 10 or 11, she won the U.S. juvenile title in 2018. At 15, she captured her first U.S.national championship and placed fourth at her first senior World Championships. She also won gold at the 2022 Junior World Championships and later earned silver medals at Skate America and the MK John Wilson Trophy.The success continued. Levito won the 2023 U.S. Championships and took bronze in 2024. She then claimed silver at the 2024 World Championships before finishing fourth in 2025. Balancing school and training was difficult, so she studied through an online learning academy.Her family background shaped her journey. Isabeau Levito mother Chiara Garberi-Levito, moved from Milan to the United States in 1997 and introduced her to skating after watching the 2010 Winter Olympics. She explained she enrolled her daughter because she was concerned about her balance and wanted her to grow step by step while giving her every opportunity to improve. Coaches quickly noticed the child’s natural comfort on the ice.Isabeau Levito father, Joseph “Tim” Levito, supported her career before his passing in 2019. Levito speaks English at home and also communicates in Italian with relatives. She is currently single and focused on skating. Isabeau Levito net worth in 2026 is estimated between $500,000 and $1 million (per essentially sports), coming from competitions and endorsements.
Article Summary: Isabeau levito, 18, competed at the 2026 winter olympics in milan-cortina. Her teammate alysa liu ended a 20-year medal drought for the united states in women's singles. The last american woman to win an olympic medal was sasha cohen, who captured silver in 2006.

Article Title: Tom Brady’s Olympic Hockey Cameo Has Fans and Analysts Questioning His ‘Neutral’ Take on the Patriots
Article Text:
Tom Brady watches the USA vs. Canada women’s hockey gold-medal game at the Winter Olympics after previously saying he “didn’t have a dog in the fight” for Super Bowl LX. (Image via Getty)

Mike Kadlick calls out Tom Brady’s ‘no dog in the fight’ line after Team USA’s overtime win

Tom Brady’s $150 million bunker and Livvy Dunne partnership keep his post-retirement profile loud

Tom Brady tried to play neutral before Super Bowl LX, telling everyone he “didn't have a dog in the fight” when the New England Patriots faced the Seattle Seahawks at Levi’s Stadium earlier this month.A week later, he was in the stands at the Santa Giulia Arena, all in on Team USA in the women’s gold-medal game against Canada, and an NFL analyst immediately called him on it.In the buildup to Patriots vs. Seahawks in Super Bowl LX, the six-time Super Bowl winner tried to stay above the fray.“I don't have a dog in the fight in this one. May the best team win,” Brady said. “And in terms of the Patriots, this is a new chapter in New England, and I'm glad everyone's embraced the Mike Vrabel regime, all the amazing players that have worked so hard to get their club to this position.”That distance didn’t sit perfectly with everyone in New England, but it at least sounded like he was staying out of it. Then came Thursday’s women’s hockey final at the Winter Olympics. Megan Keller scored just over four minutes into overtime to give the United States a 2-1 win over Canada in the gold-medal game, and Brady was right there for the moment.He shared a picture of his son, Benjamin, celebrating the win with a friend on his Instagram story, adding the line: “Most Dominant Team in the world.”NFL analyst Mike Kadlick spotted the shift and went straight to X with a sharp question: “Does he have a dog in the fight?”It was a clean little jab. Brady wanted to be neutral when the Patriots were playing for a Lombardi, but he had no issue declaring the U.S. women the best in the world from his Olympic seat. Nobody is mad he backed Team USA. The point is simple: when you tell fans you’re out of the rivalry business, they’re going to notice every time you pick a side.While everyone was dissecting his “dog in the fight” stance, Brady’s off-field life kept getting bigger. Earlier this week, Mary K. Jacob of the New York Post reported that his 25,000-square-foot mansion on Indian Creek Island in Miami is effectively finished, years after he and Gisele Bündchen bought the two-acre waterfront lot for about $17 million in 2020 and tore down the old home.The new build sits on one of the most tightly guarded pieces of land in the country, with a pale stone-and-glass façade facing Biscayne Bay, deep balconies, and a long run of private dockage. Behind the house, photos show his reported $6.5 million speedboat and two Yamaha WaveRunners, each around $20,000, parked on lifts. Records cited in the report note that Brady transferred the property into a new trust in December and took out a $35 million loan, with documents stating the beneficiary intends to make it his Florida homestead.That same week, his business side added another headline name. As Jake Fenner reported, Brady’s NoBull brand brought in social media star and former LSU gymnast Livvy Dunne as an athlete, investor, and partner. Dunne announced it with an Instagram shoot and the caption: “sooo excited to join the nobull team alongside @tombrady as an athlete, investor, and partner... LFG!”Brady dropped into the comments with his trademark response, simply adding “LFG” and three raised-hand emojis. Dunne, who has shifted from college gymnastics into a mix of real estate and sponsorship deals, is also often seen backing Pittsburgh Pirates ace Paul Skenes. At the Super Bowl, she told the Daily Mail, “I'll try to make all of his starts, that's my goal this year,” and added, “We both travel so much, it's so important to put your phone down and just be with one another and be there for each other. ”Put it all together and the picture is clear. Brady might say he doesn’t have a dog in certain fights, but between picking sides for Team USA on Olympic ice, building a $150 million bunker in Miami, and signing one of the biggest names in college sports to his brand, he’s not exactly living a quiet, neutral retirement.
Article Summary: Tom brady tried to play neutral before super bowl lx, telling everyone he “didn’t have a dog in the fight” when the new england patriots faced the seattle seahawks. A week later, he was in the stands at the santa giulia arena, all in on team usa in the women’s gold-medal game against canada.

Article Title: NBA trade rumor: Insiders link Clippers to stunning Giannis Antetokounmpo chatter involving Kawhi Leonard
Article Text:
Giannis Antetokounmpo. Image via: Dylan Buell/ Getty Image

Why the Clippers could monitor Giannis Antetokounmpo



Giannis Antetokounmpo. Image via: Jared C. Tilton / Getty Images

Giannis Antetokounmpo and Kawhi Leonard's current stats



Giannis Antetokounmpo's contract situation and salary cap implications



What the Bucks would want in return



Multiple unprotected first-round picks

Pick swaps

Young, high-upside rotation players

Cap flexibility

The Los Angeles Clippers have surfaced in fresh league chatter involving Giannis Antetokounmpo , with insiders revealing that teams pursuing the Milwaukee Bucks star recently contacted Los Angeles about Kawhi Leonard’s availability. According to ClutchPoints reporter Brett Siegel, two Giannis suitors checked in with the Clippers ahead of the deadline to gauge interest in Leonard. The calls did not lead to movement, yet they signal how interconnected both superstars have become in trade discussions.The Clippers sit 26-28 and 10th in the Western Conference after recovering from a 6-21 start. Milwaukee, meanwhile, is 23-30 and 12th in the East. As both teams navigate uncertain playoff paths, league executives are evaluating long-term direction, contracts, and draft capital that could reshape the summer market.The NBA trade rumor linking the Clippers and Giannis Antetokounmpo stems from roster flexibility and new draft assets. On Clutch Scoops, Tomer Azarly said, “The Clippers could enter the Giannis sweepstakes if he’s available. They would have four very, very good draft picks, including the two Pacers ones that teams could be interested in.The Bucks could be interested in a couple of young players. So, could you pair Giannis and Kawhi together? That could be an interesting combo if you’re able to. ”Los Angeles strengthened its asset base by acquiring Bennedict Mathurin, Isaiah Jackson, a protected 2026 first-round pick, an unprotected 2029 first-round pick and a future second-round selection from Indiana. Those selections create credible leverage if a franchise player becomes attainable.Antetokounmpo is averaging 28 points, 10 rebounds, and 5.6 assists while shooting 64.5 percent from the field. Leonard has also been highly productive at 27.9 points per game on 49.1 percent shooting. From a basketball standpoint, pairing both would immediately elevate championship projections. The scenario now depends on Milwaukee’s willingness to engage.Any NBA trade rumor involving Giannis Antetokounmpo must account for his contract. He signed a three-year, $175,369,698 fully guaranteed deal with Milwaukee, carrying an average annual salary of $58,456,566. In 2025-26, he will earn $54,126,450 with a matching cap hit, per Spotrac.Antetokounmpo addressed his long-term outlook during an interview with COSMOTE TV. “As Americans say, opinions are cheap; that’s why everyone has one. Right now, at this moment, I’m in Milwaukee… I don’t know if I’ll leave, it’s not up to me. If it was up to me, maybe I already would have left. In a year and a half, when I become a free agent at 32, it will be up to me,” Antetokounmpo said.“No one can dare come and tell me not to play. I never gave anyone that right, as long as my legs allow me, I’ll be out there.”His salary would require significant matching contracts and draft equity. So there is also a financial weight that might influence the discussion.If this NBA trade rumor advances to reality, Milwaukee’s asking price would be substantial. Franchise-level talent rarely moves without multiple unprotected first-round picks, young rotation players, and cap flexibility.At least two to four unprotected first-round picks to secure long-term draft control and rebuild flexibility.Future first-round pick swaps to maintain leverage in upcoming drafts.Proven young talent who can contribute immediately while still fitting a long-term timeline.Contracts that provide financial breathing room or allow Milwaukee to reshape the roster quickly.The Clippers’ newly acquired Pacers picks provide value, though Milwaukee could seek additional compensation to justify parting with a former MVP. League insiders have already connected Leonard’s situation to past blockbuster decisions. Siegel said, “There were two teams in particular that were pursuing Giannis that had made calls to the Clippers about Kawhi Leonard, checking in on his availability.”He added, “From the front office stand point and if you’re looking at this through the lens of the Clippers future, it probably makes a lot more sense to just trade him the off-season.”At this stage, discussions are exploratory. Still, with both franchises balancing performance and long-term planning, the possibility of a surprising summer cannot be dismissed.
Article Summary: The los angeles clippers have surfaced in fresh league chatter involving giannis antetokounmpo. Teams pursuing the milwaukee bucks star recently contacted los angeles about kawhi leonard’s availability. The clippers sit 26-28 and 10th in the western conference after recovering from a 6-21 start.

Article Title: Mitch Marner Net Worth 2026: Mitch Marner’s net worth in 2026: Exploring his career earnings, salary, contract details, achievements, investments, and more
Article Text:
Mitch Marner's overtime winning goal at just 1:22 into overtime that led the Canadiens to book a spot at the semifinal (Image via Getty Images)

Mitch Marner’s net worth and career earnings in 2026

Marner & Celebrini on Canada's quarterfinal win vs. Czechia



Mitch Marner’s salary and contract details





Mitch Marner’s investments and brand deals

Mitch Marner is one of the most promising players of all time who has carved a niche in the field of ice hockey with his skills, playing techniques, and high-scoring abilities. In a very brief period of time, he has solidified his place and quickly established himself as a dynamic force on the ice. The player has recently grabbed eyeballs with his performance at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics 2026, where his timely overtime goal led Team Canada to the semifinals against Finland.As per reports, it was Mitch Marner's overtime winning goal at just 1:22 into overtime that led the Canadiens to book a spot at the semifinal. Canada trailed late in regulation, with Czechia taking a 3–2 lead less than eight minutes from the end, but Marner’s goal at the end stole the show.Besides this, the Vegas Golden Knights right winger has reached several milestones, including his 500 career points in just 467 games, and a career-high 99 points in 2022-23, which earned him a Selke Trophy nomination for his defensive play. Apart from a successful career, the player has also amassed huge wealth with his NHL salary and contract. Let’s take a look at his current earnings, salary, endorsements, investments, and more.According to Sportskeeda, Mitchell Marner has a net worth of between $20 million and $25 million as of now in 2026. He is regarded as one of the wingers in the NHL. With his recent shift to the Vegas Golden Knights, reports suggest that his value and recognition have increased in the league.Marner has recently signed an eight-year, $96 million extension with Vegas, which is an average annual value of $12 million, adding to his annual net worth, and according to PuckPedia, his total career earning is estimated to be around $97.65 million.After serving the Toronto Maple Leafs for years, Mitch Marner has signed a 8 year, $96,000,000 contract with a cap hit and AAV of $12,000,000 per season, playing for the Vegas Golden Knights. His contract expires at the end of the 2032-33 season, making Marner an Unrestricted Free Agent. He will earn a total salary of $15 million in the 2025-26 season, according to PuckPedia.As Marner has established himself in the NHL with his illustrious career scores, the player has also earned multiple brand deals and endorsements over the years. As of 2026, Marner has signed an endorsement and aligned himself with world-famous brands like Nike, Beats by Dre, RedBull, Amazon Canada, Oakley, and Intact Insurance.As for his investments, Marner owns a fleet of luxurious cars, watches, and several real estate properties. Reports suggest the player owns high-end Ferrari and Porsche cars with watches from Rolex and Audemars Piguet. He has also invested in modern condos in Las Vegas and family-friendly properties back in Ontario, Canada.
Article Summary: Mitch marner's overtime winning goal at just 1:22 into overtime that led the canadiens to book a spot at the semifinal. The vegas golden knights right winger has reached several milestones, including his 500 career points in just 467 games, and a career-high 99 points in 2022-23.

Article Title: Not Gonna Lie podcast host rejects CBC Olympics’ description and wants to be known as “Jason and Kylie Kelce”
Article Text:
Not Gonna Lie podcast host rejects CBC Olympics’ description and wants to be known as “Jason and Kylie Kelce” (Image via X: Jason Kelce and Kylie Kelce)

Jason Kelce brought CBC Olympics post to Kylie Kelce’s attention

Kylie on Gold Medal Proposals, Cleveland Heights’ GOAT & Tiramisu Taste Test with Jason | Ep. 55

Kylie Kelce lost in her phone while attending Winter Olympics

Going in the opposite direction, the fierce tigress said! “Not Gonna Lie” podcast host Kylie Kelce does not want to be known as “Kylie Kelce and her husband.” She recently spoke on her podcast and shared a CBC Olympics post that used that phrase. She said, “Cut that out. We’ve leaned too far in the opposite direction. You know what’s great? Jason and Kylie Kelce.”Is she trying to keep her retired NFL star husband relevant? Or is she too old-fashioned to be known by her name? Unlike modern women, who often keep their maiden surname after marriage and sometimes attach their husband’s surname as initials, like “N.” or “S” to their names. Maybe Kylie just wanted her husband to be known and named as well. Could be anything. Anyway, let’s talk about her Winter Olympics snippets now.The main event at Milan for the mom-of-four was the Women’s Ice Hockey semi-finals. She admitted they had not planned to attend, but when they heard women were playing, they decided to go. Kylie is a former field hockey player.Afterward, CBC Olympics shared a picture of the couple in the spectator stands. They captioned it: “Kylie Kelce and her husband supporting @TeamUSA women’s hockey.”The retired Philadelphia Eagles center brought the post to Kylie’s attention at breakfast.She said on the podcast, “This is ridiculous. Cut that out. We’ve leaned too far in the opposite direction.” We’ve already established what’s great for Jason’s wife. She quickly shifted the podcast to a different topic and expressed displeasure for the photo the CBC Olympics shared.The photo posted by CBC Olympics showed her lost in her phone. She said, “I’m a little sad about this because I’m barely ever on my phone. Last night, I was busy watching [women’s hockey semi-finals], and then you caught me on my phone. So, you caught me. You got me.”Then the 33-year-old NFL WAG pointed out that “people were enjoying the caption though,” and later quietly admitted, “Maybe we should say both names. But [pause], you know, [tilts her head to one side], sure [chuckles].” She seems confused. Again, like most modern women.The ardent Philadelphia Eagles fan shared that it was the first competition they attended at the Winter Olympics. The women’s ice hockey team dominated in a way she couldn’t explain.Her favorite story from the global event was Cory and Korey [Cory Thiesse and Korey Dropkin] winning a silver medal in mixed doubles curling at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics on Feb 10.
Article Summary: Not gonna lie podcast host rejects cbc olympics’ description and wants to be known as “jason and kylie kelce” jason kelce brought the post to kylie’s attention at breakfast. She quickly shifted the podcast to a different topic and expressed displeasure for the photo the cbc olympics shared.

Article Title: Winter Olympics 2026: Haley Winn’s brothers steal hearts in Milan with emotional tribute before gold medal clash
Article Text:
Haley Winn (Image Via Getty)

Haley Winn’s brothers Ryan Winn, Tommy Winn and Casey Winn turn Olympic support into a viral moment

Haley Winn is preparing for the biggest game of her young career at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan. The 22-year-old Team USA defenseman is set to face Canada in the gold medal game, with the world watching. But just hours before the spotlight gets even brighter, it was her family who stole a quiet moment. Her three older brothers shared a heartfelt message that quickly spread across social media and reminded everyone what this stage truly means.In a video posted on X, Ryan Winn, Tommy Winn, and Casey Winn spoke directly to their sister. They said, “No matter the outcome of these games, it does not change who you are. You have three older brothers that now look up to you. You will always be our champion.” The clip showed Haley as a little girl, wobbling on the ice in gear too big for her, while her mother cheered from the background. It then cut to her Olympic journey. The message was simple. Win or lose, she is already a champion to them.The video did more than just make people emotional. It told the story of how far Haley Winn has come. Her brothers spoke about how she dreamed of the Olympics even before she could properly walk.They talked about her grit and how she learned to push through pain without losing her smile. It felt honest, not staged. That is why it connected. Haley Winn has built an impressive resume even before these Milan Olympics.She won gold medals with Team USA at the 2023 and 2025 IIHF Women’s World Championships. Now, she stands one game away from adding Olympic gold to that list. Facing Canada in the final only makes the moment bigger.Meanwhile, her brothers have become fan favorites inside the arena. They are not quiet supporters. They show up in bold red, white, and blue outfits. American flag jackets, bright jumpsuits, even bald eagle masks. When Team USA scores and “Free Bird” plays, they flap their arms like wings and celebrate with full energy.Ryan Winn, who works as a videographer, has helped film and share many of these moments on TikTok and X. One caption read, “Exhibit U S and A.” The posts quickly went viral, drawing attention not just to Haley, but to women’s hockey as a whole.As Haley Winn skates toward Olympic history in Milan, she carries more than a stick and a jersey. She carries the loud, proud love of her brothers and a reminder that some victories are bigger than medals.
Article Summary: Haley winn is preparing for the biggest game of her young career at the 2026 winter olympics in milan. The 22-year-old team usa defenseman is set to face canada in the gold medal game. Her brothers shared a heartfelt message that quickly spread across social media and reminded everyone what this stage truly means.

Article Title: "We have to make a decision!": Washington Capitals' Alex Ovechkin shares details on his NHL future and retirement plans
Article Text:
Washington Capitals captain Alex Ovechkin shared his plans regarding his future in the National Hockey League (Image via AFP Photo)

Alex Ovechkin addresses his NHL future with the Washington Capitals and beyond, amid playoff push

Alex Ovechkin is three-time Hart Trophy winner

Washington Capitals captain Alex Ovechkin has recently delivered a candid assessment regarding his future in the NHL , addressing his long-running speculation about retirement and what comes next after the 2025-26 season. Ovechkin, who is in the final year of his current contract with the Capitals, clarified that he has yet to decide his playing future beyond this season.Despite intense media and fan interest, the 39-year-old said he isn't in a rush to announce retirement and has no final decision about his future beyond his current contract, and he won’t likely make a hasty decision by the end of the season. It is to be noted that the Caps are currently 29-23-7, and four points behind the Boston Bruins in the Eastern Conference wildcard race.Alex Ovechkin, the Washington Capitals' captain and NHL's all-time leading goal scorer, has dropped candid insights on his post-season plans following the Olympic break. The Russian star emphasized that he has not taken any final decision about his future beyond his current contract, which is supposed to expire after this season.Speaking to NHL beat writer Tom Gulitti, Ovechkin stated, “No, I don’t know yet. We have to make a decision. We have to talk with the family, with (Capitals owner) Ted (Leonsis), [general manager Chris Patrick], and then we’ll see.”Ovechkin stated he needs to consult with his family, Capitals team owner Ted Leonsis, and general manager Chris Patrick before committing further. On the other hand, speculation has swirled due to his age and the team's position, but he dismissed retirement talk for now.The three-time Hart Trophy winner further stated, “We have ups and downs. It’s not about me. You see, everybody was maybe a little struggling because last year, we scored like five, six goals in a game, and it was easy.” This clearly states that he won’t be deciding anything about his future by the end of the season.As for his performance, Ovechkin has 22 goals and 48 points in 59 games, trailing teammate Tom Wilson. However, reports suggest that last season he scored 44 goals in 65 games, including breaking Wayne Gretzky's record, setting high expectations despite a fibula injury.It is to be noted that Ovechkin is also currently on a break, as Russia has not been invited to the 2026 Winter Olympics. The veteran player could be seen in action against the Capitals in their first game after the Olympic break, where they will lock horns against the Philadelphia Flyers.
Article Summary: Washington capitals captain alex ovechkin shared his plans regarding his future in the national hockey league. The 39-year-old said he isn't in a rush to announce retirement and has no final decision about his future beyond his current contract. The caps are currently 29-23-7 and four points behind the boston bruins in the eastern conference wildcard race.

Article Title: Jakub Mensik net worth in 2026: Salary and prize money of the 19-year-old tennis star who beat world No. 2 Jannik Sinner at Qatar Open
Article Text:
Jakub Mensik net worth 2026 explained.Image via: Getty

How Jakub Menšík built his rising tennis fortune



One big night can change how a career feels. For Jakub Menšík, Doha was that night. At the 2026 Qatar Open in Doha on February 19, the 19-year-old Czech delivered the biggest result of his career by defeating the world No. 2, Jannik Sinner, in the quarterfinals. He came through a tight three-set match, winning 7-6(3), 2-6, 6-3 after more than two hours on court. It was a composed and confident performance against one of the most consistent players in men’s tennis, and it sent Menšík into the semifinals with some serious momentum. He served boldly, swung freely and trusted his power when the pressure tightened.A win like that changes things. It gives a young player a lot of confidence. Opponents start taking him seriously. Fans stop calling him “one for the future.” And whenever a teenager breaks through like that, curiosity naturally turns to the bigger picture, which includes what it means financially. Let's take a look at his net worth.According to his official ATP Tour profile, Menšík has earned approximately $5.28 million in career prize money so far. For someone who is still only 19, that’s a whopping number.It reflects steady progression, consistent tour-level results and the ability to compete deep into events. But prize money figures can be misleading. The $5.28 million listed on the ATP site is gross income. Professional tennis players pay their own way. Coaches, physios and fitness trainers are not optional at this level but essential. Travel is constant and international. Hotels, flights and tournament expenses stack up quickly. Add management commissions and taxes across multiple countries, and the headline figure shrinks fast.Once those deductions are factored in, industry estimates suggest Menšík’s 2026 net worth likely falls somewhere between $1.5 million and $3.5 million. That range is typical for a rising ATP player who is earning well but still investing heavily in building a long-term career.Commercially, he’s still early in his journey. He doesn’t yet have the blockbuster endorsement deals that established top-10 stars command. However, statement wins dramatically increase visibility. Brands are drawn to youth, momentum and upside and a fearless teenager who just beat one of the sport’s most consistent players checks all three boxes.Right now, Menšík’s finances reflect a player climbing rather than one who has fully arrived. If performances like Doha become regular instead of rare, both his ranking and his earning power could rise very quickly.
Article Summary: Jakub menšík beat world no. 2 jannik sinner 7-6(3), 2-6, 6-3 in the quarterfinals of the 2026 qatar open in doha on february 19. The 19-year-old czech has earned approximately $5.28 million in career prize money so far. Industry estimates suggest his 2026 net worth likely falls between $1.5 million and $3.5million.

Article Title: Tommaso Giacomel: Winter Olympics 2026: Tommaso Giacomel collapses during men’s 15km mass start biathlon in Anterselva
Article Text:
Winter Olympics 2026: Tommaso Giacomel collapses during men’s 15km mass start biathlon in Anterselva(Image via Getty Images)



Tommaso Giacomel’s Olympic heartbreak as Johannes Dale-Skjevdal wins gold

Tommaso Giacomel looked ready for a medal. Then, in a shocking turn, he was sitting in the snow. The 22-year-old Italian biathlon star shocked fans after collapsing during the men’s 15km mass start at the 2026 Winter Olympics. The worrying moment happened in Anterselva during the Milan-Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics. Tommaso Giacomel was in strong form and even led the race at the halfway mark. He had hit all his targets in two shooting stages without a single miss. The home crowd believed a medal was coming. But things changed quickly. Giacomel began to slow down on the snowy track. Other athletes passed him. Soon after, television cameras showed him sitting on the ground in the woods section of the course. His ski poles were beside him. Officials rushed to check on him.According to Eurosport, commentators described it as a “Cursed Olympics” for Giacomel and reported that he appeared to struggle with his breathing. He did not finish the race. In fact, he was the only one among the 30 competitors who did not cross the finish line. More than an hour later, Italy coach Fabio Cianciana gave an update. He said, “Health comes before the races.If Tommy felt some pain in the ribs, it is right that he has stopped. ” He added, “After one minute, he already felt better. He went on his legs for the first medical check. Now he is doing other treatments and he is fine.”Cianciana also spoke about how well Giacomel was performing before the incident. He said, “The race was going very well. Once he passed unharmed from the prone shooting, we knew that Tommaso would have been very dangerous on the standing shooting.”While Giacomel’s race ended in pain, the competition continued. Johannes Dale-Skjevdal of Norway won gold with a perfect performance. He hit all 20 of his shots. His teammate Sturla Holm Laegreid took silver and finished the Games with a medal in each of the five races he entered.For Giacomel, this was his sixth event of the Olympics. He had already raced in the individual, sprint, pursuit, mass start, and team relay. He also won a silver medal in the mixed relay, which means he will not leave the Games without success.Still, the scene in Anterselva left fans concerned. A race that started with hope ended with worry. Thankfully, his coach confirmed that he is stable and receiving care.
Article Summary: Tommaso giacomel collapsed during the men’s 15km mass start at the 2026 winter olympics. The 22-year-old italian biathlon star shocked fans after collapsing during the race in anterselva. He was the only one among the 30 competitors who did not cross the finish line.

Article Title: Brittany Mahomes: Randi Mahomes celebrates Brittany Mahomes as she marks special life update while Patrick Mahomes focuses on injury comeback
Article Text:
Brittany Mahomes and Patrick Mahomes (Instagram)

United WE Announces Brittany Mahomes as First Champion for Change Winner



"at the decision-making table,"

In Kansas City, the Mahomes name is synonymous with winning but while Patrick is busy leading the Chiefs and recovering from his injury, Brittany Mahomes is carving out a legacy that is arguably just as historic. On February 19, 2026, it was officially announced that Brittany has been named the inaugural recipient of the Champion for Change Award by United WE.The honor isn't just a "thank you" for being a local celebrity, it’s a recognition of the serious economic and cultural shift Brittany has spearheaded in Missouri and beyond.The primary reason for the award is Brittany’s visionary leadership in women’s professional sports. As a co-owner of the KC Current, she didn't just buy into a team, she invested in an entire ecosystem. She was a driving force behind the construction of CPKC Stadium, which made global headlines for being the first stadium on Earth built specifically for a women’s professional team.United WE noted that her leadership proves that when women arethe entire economy grows stronger. By treating women’s sports as a "growing economic engine" rather than a side project, she has changed the blueprint for sports ownership in America.Beyond the soccer pitch, the award highlights her philanthropic work. Alongside her husband, Patrick Mahomes , Brittany has channeled millions through the 15 and the Mahomies Foundation. These funds have gone directly into underserved communities, focusing on children's health, wellness, and educational opportunities.The organization emphasized that Brittany’s role as an entrepreneur, investor, and mother of three makes her the perfect face for this new award. She represents a generation of women who aren't just participating in the conversation, they are leading it.Randi Mahomes celebrated this achievement of her daughter-in-law on her Instagram story, sharing her excitement and publicly showing support for Brittany’s special milestone.The award will be presented on May 6, 2026, during a milestone event at CPKC Stadium. It’s a full-circle moment for Brittany, receiving the "Champion for Change" honor in the very venue she helped build to change the game for women.As she continues to expand her reach including her recent induction into the UT Tyler Athletics Hall of Fame, Brittany Mahomes is proving that her impact on Kansas City is only just beginning.And as for Patrick Mahomes, who after the most difficult season of his career is finally giving Chiefs Kingdom something to smile about. As of late February 2026, the three-time Super Bowl MVP is well into his recovery from the torn ACL and LCL that ended his 2025 campaign prematurely.
Article Summary: Brittany mahomes has been named the inaugural recipient of the champion for change award by united we. The award will be presented on may 6, 2026, during a milestone event at cpkc stadium. Alongside her husband, patrick mahomes, brittany has channeled millions through the mahomies foundation.

Article Title: Mens Hockey Olympics: Fans furious after NBC delays Canada vs Finland semifinal coverage as Sidney Crosby sidelined with injury
Article Text:
Mens Hockey Olympics: Fans furious after NBC delays Canada vs Finland semifinal coverage as Sidney Crosby sidelined with injury (Image via Getty)



Mens Hockey Olympics : Sidney Crosby ruled out as Canada faces Finland after both teams win dramatic overtime quarterfinals

Winter Olympics fans woke up early on Friday ready to watch one of the biggest games of the 2026 Milano Cortina Games. But many were shocked when they could not see the start of the Canada vs Finland men’s hockey semifinal on regular TV. The game began at 10:40 a.m. Eastern Time. Instead of airing live on cable, the opening part of the matchup was available only on Peacock. USA Network, which is owned by NBCUniversal, showed the women’s speed skating 1500m during that time. NBC later scheduled delayed coverage of the hockey game at 11:50 a.m. ET on USA Network.Fans quickly shared their anger online. Many said they felt frustrated that such a major semifinal was not shown live on television. The matchup featured top-seeded Canada and defending 2022 Olympic champion Finland, making the decision even more surprising for viewers across the United States.The semifinal was already a huge story before the broadcast issue. Canada entered the game as the No. 1 seed, while Finland came in as the defending gold medalist from the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing.Both teams fought hard in the quarterfinals earlier in the week.Finland edged Switzerland 3-2 in overtime. Canada also needed extra time to beat Czechia 4-3. Those close wins set up what many believed would be one of the best hockey games of the tournament.However, Canada had to prepare without its captain, Sidney Crosby. The veteran forward suffered a lower-body injury during Wednesday’s quarterfinal and was ruled out of the semifinal. His absence was another major talking point heading into Friday’s game.Still, much of the online reaction focused on the broadcast choice. Fans took to X to express how they felt.One fan wrote, “Not having this Canada-Finland hockey game on a dedicated tv channel is infuriating to me.”Another posted, “Absolutely wild the Canada Finland semi final game isn’t on tv right now.”A different viewer added, “Why is my USA channel playing speed skating??? All your stars yet I have to have peacock to watch???”One more comment read, “Everywhere I look, I see that USA Network is supposed to be broadcasting the CAN/FIN hockey semifinal. Yet — they aren’t.”For many hockey fans, the issue was not about streaming itself. It was about missing the first hour of a major Olympic semifinal on traditional television. With two strong teams on the ice and a place in the gold medal game at stake, viewers expected full live coverage from the opening puck drop.
Article Summary: The canada vs finland men’s hockey semifinal began at 10:40 a.m. eastern time. Instead of airing live on cable, the opening part of the matchup was available only on peacock. Usa network, which is owned by nbcuniversal, showed the women’s speed skating 1500m during that time.

Article Title: Novak Djokovic Marbella Mansion: $10M Villa with Sauna, Theatre & Tennis Court
Article Text:
Novak Djokovic's Marbella mansion has stunning views of the Mediterranean sea.Image via: Getty/ GTRES

A peaceful base away from the tour for Novak Djokovic



Tennis legend Novak Djokovic has spent years living out of suitcases, hotel rooms and player lounges. So when he goes home, he really goes home. For the tennis great, that place is Marbella, Spain — a quiet, sun-soaked corner of the Costa del Sol where he can switch off from the noise of the tour and just be with his family. His villa is located in Sierra Blanca, one of Marbella’s most private and high-end residential areas. It sits slightly above the coastline, with open views of the Mediterranean and the mountains behind it. The neighborhood is known for security and seclusion. For someone as globally recognized as Djokovic, that kind of privacy isn’t a luxury, but a necessity.The house is large but not flashy. It is reported to span close to 1,000 square metres, with open living spaces and several bedrooms. Inside, the design is simple and calm, with marble floors, soft colours and large glass doors that bring in natural light. Outside, there is a spacious swimming pool and open terraces where the family can relax. The gardens are neatly kept and offer privacy and quiet.The villa also supports his training routine. It reportedly has nine bedrooms and eight bathrooms, along with a private gym and a spa area that includes a sauna and Turkish bath.There is a cinema room, a games room and a private tennis court where he can practise away from the public eye. With sea and mountain views around the property, the home works as both a peaceful retreat and a private training base. For a player known for his strict routines and recovery work, having those facilities at home makes sense. Even in downtime, the work doesn’t completely stop.The mansion is believed to be worth around $10 million approximately, reflecting both the prime location and its size. Djokovic is said to have settled there around 2020, after spending time in the area and enjoying the climate. Marbella offers warm weather most of the year, which is ideal for training. But more importantly, it offers space that is away from cameras and constant attention.For fans, it’s nice to see this side of Djokovic. On court, he is intense and fully focused. In Marbella, life is quieter and slower for the tennis icon. His home seems not about showing off, but about comfort, privacy and balance. After everything he has achieved in tennis, that may be what matters most.
Article Summary: Novak djokovic's marbella mansion has stunning views of the mediterranean sea. It reportedly has nine bedrooms and eight bathrooms, along with a private gym and a spa area. There is a cinema room, a games room and a private tennis court where he can practise away from the public eye.

Article Title: Winter Olympic 2026 Live: USA men’s hockey in semifinals, Curling controversy, Alysa Liu gold and Day 14 medal count updates
Article Text:
Winter Olympic 2026 Live: Megan Keller hockey overtime goal lifts Team USA, Alysa Liu shines, curling controversy and Day 14 medal count updates (Image via Getty)

U.S. men’s hockey beats Sweden in OT, moves into Olympic semifinals

U.S. women’s curling to face Switzerland in Olympic semifinal

Alysa Liu wins Olympic gold in women’s singles figure skating in Milan

Megan Keller scores overtime winner as U.S. women’s hockey defeats Canada for Olympic gold



Medal count after 95 of 116 events at Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics



Casey Wasserman faces calls to resign as LA28 Olympic chairman

Olympic curling scandal raises questions about trust in the sport

Day 14 at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina delivered big moments and fresh updated. Team USA grabbed headlines as Megan Keller scored an overtime goal to beat Canada in women’s hockey, while Alysa Liu captured gold in women’s figure skating. At the same time, curling found itself under fresh scrutiny, adding tension off the ice. With 95 events completed, the medal table continues to shift as Norway, the United States, and Italy battle for the top spots.Team USA’s men played a huge game in Milan to reach the Olympic semifinals. In a tense quarterfinal matchup against Sweden, the United States scored in overtime to win and move on. Now the Americans will face Slovakia in the semifinal, set for later today. This marks a big moment for U.S. hockey, reflecting strong effort and clutch play when it mattered most.The U.S. women’s curling team stayed strong and advanced to the semifinals again after topping Switzerland in a close match. They will meet Switzerland one more time in Friday’s big semifinal game. Sweden and Canada also earned spots in the women’s curling semifinals, setting up a packed Friday of medal battles on the ice.On Thursday night in Milan, 20-year-old Alysa Liu won gold in women’s singles figure skating. She became the first American woman to win this Olympic title since 2002. She performed her free skate to “MacArthur Park” at the Milano Ice Skating Arena and moved ahead of Japan’s Kaori Sakamoto, who won silver, and Ami Nakai, who took bronze.After her skate, Alysa Liu smiled, brushed off her shoulders, and waved to the crowd. The result was confirmed by official Olympic scoring shared with media on site. This was one of the biggest moments for Team USA in Italy.The hockey final came down to seconds. Team USA trailed late against Canada in the gold-medal game on Thursday. Then Hilary Knight tipped a shot from Laila Edwards with just 124 seconds left to tie the game 1-1.In overtime, Megan Keller scored 4 minutes and 7 seconds in to seal a 2-1 win for the United States. The celebration was loud and emotional. This victory gave the U.S. women another Olympic hockey gold medal after years of close battles with Canada.With 95 events completed, Norway leads the table with 16 gold medals and 34 total medals. The United States now has 9 gold medals and 27 total medals. Italy follows with 9 gold and 26 total.Germany, Japan, France, and the Netherlands remain in the top group.Away from competition, Olympic politics made news. Casey Wasserman, chairman of the LA28 Olympic organizing committee, faced public calls to step down during a gubernatorial forum in Sacramento. Several candidates answered “yes” when asked if he should resign.Curling is also under the spotlight. Reports earlier this month raised concerns about possible rule violations in ski jumping and other events. While officials called some claims rumors, the World Anti-Doping Agency said it would review any credible information. Coverage from Milan described this as a moment that could affect how athletes and teams are monitored moving forward.
Article Summary: The medal table continues to shift as norway, the united states, and italy battle for the top spots. Team usa’s men played a huge game in milan to reach the olympic semifinals. Casey wasserman, chairman of the la28 olympic organizing committee, faced calls to step down during a gubernatorial forum.
